title: (x) “Fatal Flower” from a silent movie title card - Poor Richard {Patricia, Mark S}
content:
Hi, I'm trying to find an equivalent for the font used in this (attached) silent movie title card. And, ii the context of a wider search, would anyone know of the fonts used in title cards (I guess, that most of these where hand drawn)?

Like in the other cards:  
\_ [http://www.fda.gov/oc/history/slideshow/graphics/132.JPG](http://web.archive.org/web/20101125213742/http:/www.fda.gov/oc/history/slideshow/graphics/132.JPG "http://www.fda.gov/oc/history/slideshow/graphics/132.JPG")

As always, thanks!

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [fontID.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20101125213742/http:/typophile.com/files/fontID.jpg) | 9.12 KB |
author: Martin LAllier

comments.content: It looks like a slanted version of an old metal font called Packard. I'm not sure if there is a digital version. It's a little hard to Google "packard font"--you get nothing but stuff about HP fonts.
I take that back. Not Packard. Let me get back to you on that.
